title: dj asked for a detailed comparison between nanobot and openclaw, how web search,
snippet: [2026-02-22 14:41] dj asked for a detailed comparison between nanobot and openclaw, how web search, spawn sub-agents, GitHub skills, and the various Markdown docs work, so I explained each item while reinforcing his preference for short mixed Chinese-English replies and noting he is learning Spanish. He reiterated our identities and email contacts, requested a test email (which succeeded), and learned that inbox polling needs a custom IMAP reader that we added to the wishlist. dj expanded the wishlist to include GitHub integration, described the dedicated GitHub account "djclaw," and asked for a step-by-step setup guide. I installed the gh CLI, walked him through PAT-based authentication, and received the PAT so I can complete the login and configuration.

title: User detailed a Kraig Adams style operating memo that emphasizes leverage-driven
snippet: [2026-02-22 15:02] User detailed a Kraig Adams style operating memo that emphasizes leverage-driven storytelling, binary contrasts, and minimal systems. snippet: [2026-02-22 16:41] The assistant reported that npm‚Äôs fetch-timeout is already configured at 180000 ms (180 seconds) and found no 60-second limit within npm‚Äôs settings, implying the earlier cutoff likely came from an external system constraint. title: The assistant explained that npm‚Äôs own timeout isn‚Äôt the issue; instead, a 60-se
snippet: [2026-02-22 16:44] The assistant explained that npm‚Äôs own timeout isn‚Äôt the issue; instead, a 60-second system limit terminates long commands, so it suggested splitting summarize CLI installation into `npm pack` to download the tarball followed by `npm install -g summarize-*.tgz`, or other offline/hand-deploy options. The user agreed to proceed with the `npm pack` plus local install approach.

title: Reconfirmed the prior npm install limitation: the assistant completed `npm pack
snippet: [2026-02-22 16:44] Reconfirmed the prior npm install limitation: the assistant completed `npm pack @steipete/summarize`, downloading steipete-summarize-0.11.1.tgz to /home/dj/, but `npm install -g` still fails due to a 60-second command cap rather than npm timeout. Discussed alternatives including manual tarball extraction with custom bin wiring, splitting install steps, or requesting extended execution limits. Assistant recommended manual deployment (option 1), and the user approved proceeding that way with a simple ‚ÄúÂ•Ω.‚Äù
